question: How long is the PTE Academic test?
explanation: The total time for the PTE Academic test is about 3 hours, including setup and optional breaks.

question: How many main sections does the PTE Academic test have?
explanation: The PTE Academic test has 3 main sections: Speaking & Writing (combined), Reading, and Listening.

question: What is the first section of the PTE Academic test?
explanation: The first section of the PTE Academic test is Speaking & Writing (combined).

question: Is the PTE Academic test computer-based or paper-based?
explanation: The PTE Academic test is computer-based only, with all responses typed or spoken into a computer.

question: How are the speaking responses assessed in the PTE Academic test?
options: By human examiners during the test
By human examiners after the test
explanation: Speaking responses are assessed by automated scoring technology, which evaluates pronunciation, fluency, and content.

question: What equipment do test-takers use for the speaking section?
explanation: Test-takers use a headset with microphone for the speaking section.

question: What materials are provided to use during the test?
explanation: Test-takers are provided with an erasable noteboard and pen for taking notes during the test.

question: Can you skip questions in the PTE Academic test?
options: Yes, you can skip any question
Yes, but only in the Reading section
Yes, but only in the Listening section
No, all questions must be attempted in order
explanation: No, you cannot skip questions. The test is linear, and all questions must be attempted in the given order.

question: Can you return to previous questions in PTE Academic?
options: Yes, at any time during the test
Yes, but only within the same section
Yes, but only for multiple-choice questions
No, once you move to the next question, you cannot go back
explanation: No, you cannot return to previous questions. Once you submit an answer and move on, you cannot go back.

question: Is there a break during the PTE Academic test?
options: Yes, one optional 10-minute break between sections
Yes, you can take breaks whenever you want
explanation: Yes, there is one optional 10-minute break between the Reading and Listening sections.

question: What happens if you run out of time in a section?
options: You can continue but with a penalty
The system moves you to the next section, and unanswered questions count as incorrect
explanation: If you run out of time, the system automatically moves you to the next section, and any unanswered questions count as incorrect.

question: How many task types are in the entire PTE Academic test?
explanation: There are approximately 20 different task types across all sections of the PTE Academic test.

question: Is the PTE Academic test adaptive?
options: Yes, fully adaptive across all sections
Partially adaptive in some sections only
explanation: No, the PTE Academic test is not adaptive. All test-takers receive a predetermined set of questions.

question: How is the PTE Academic test scored?
explanation: The PTE Academic test is scored on a scale of 10-90 for overall score and 10-90 for each communicative skill.

question: When do you receive your PTE Academic test results?
explanation: PTE Academic test results are typically available within 5 business days, often sooner.

question: What identification is required at the test center?
options: A valid passport or national ID (depending on country)
explanation: A valid passport is required in most countries, though some countries may accept national ID cards.

question: What biometric data is collected at the test center?
options: Photograph, signature, and palm vein scan
explanation: Test centers collect a photograph, digital signature, and palm vein scan for security purposes.

question: Can you bring your own headset to the test?
options: Yes, but it must be approved first
No, you must use the headset provided
explanation: No, you must use the headset provided by the test center.

question: What items are prohibited in the testing room?
options: Most personal items including watches, phones, food, etc.
explanation: Most personal items are prohibited, including watches, phones, food, drinks, bags, notes, and other electronic devices.

question: How is the Speaking section structured?
options: Individual speaking test with human examiner
Computer-based with microphone recording of responses
explanation: The Speaking section is computer-based; you speak into a microphone that records your responses for later automated scoring.

question: What is the time limit for the Reading section?
explanation: The Reading section has a time limit of 50-60 minutes (varies slightly by test version).

question: What is the time limit for the Speaking & Writing section?
explanation: The Speaking & Writing section has a time limit of 70-80 minutes (varies slightly by test version).

question: What is the time limit for the Listening section?
explanation: The Listening section has a time limit of 45-57 minutes (varies slightly by test version).

question: How many times can you take the PTE Academic test?
options: As many times as you want with no waiting period
explanation: You can take the PTE Academic test as many times as you want, but you must wait at least 5 days between attempts.

question: How long are PTE Academic scores valid?
explanation: PTE Academic scores are valid for 2 years from the date of the test.

question: Can you choose which institutions receive your PTE Academic scores?
options: No, scores are automatically sent to all institutions
Yes, you can send scores to unlimited institutions for free
Yes, but you must pay for each institution
Scores are only sent to you personally
explanation: Yes, you can send your scores to unlimited institutions for free through your online account.

question: What happens at the beginning of the test?
options: You immediately start with the first question
explanation: An introduction video is shown at the beginning of the test, explaining the format and providing instructions.

question: What type of introduction is provided for each section?
options: Detailed written instructions for each question type
Verbal instructions from the test administrator
explanation: Brief on-screen instructions are provided at the beginning of each section.

question: What section comes last in the PTE Academic test?
explanation: The Listening section comes last in the PTE Academic test.

question: How many essays are typically in the Writing section?
explanation: There is typically 1 essay in the Writing section, specifically the 'Write Essay' task.

question: How many Read Aloud tasks are typically in the Speaking section?
explanation: There are typically 6-7 Read Aloud tasks in the Speaking section.

question: What happens during the microphone check?
options: You read a specific sentence to test your microphone
Your voice is compared to a database
The system automatically tests the hardware
explanation: During the microphone check, you read a specific sentence that appears on the screen to test that your microphone is working properly.

question: What should you do if there is a technical problem during the test?
options: Continue and report it after the test
Raise your hand to alert the test administrator
explanation: If there is a technical problem during the test, you should raise your hand to alert the test administrator.

question: What happens if there is external noise during the Speaking section?
options: The system automatically pauses your test
You must continue despite the noise
You can request a retry of that specific question
explanation: You must continue despite external noise. The test centers try to minimize noise, but some background noise may occur.

question: How many Repeat Sentence tasks are typically in the Speaking section?
explanation: There are typically 10-12 Repeat Sentence tasks in the Speaking section.

question: How are the PTE Academic test forms created?
options: Every test-taker gets the exact same questions
Questions are randomly selected for each test-taker
Tests are pre-assembled with different but comparable questions
Test-takers choose their preferred question types
explanation: PTE Academic tests are pre-assembled with different but comparable questions, ensuring consistent difficulty levels.

question: What is the interface for the Highlight Incorrect Words task?
options: You type corrections to incorrect words
You click on words in the transcript that don't match the audio
You select from multiple choice options
explanation: For Highlight Incorrect Words, you click on words in the transcript that don't match what you hear in the audio.

question: How are Reorder Paragraphs questions presented?
options: Paragraphs are shown in a random order that you must rearrange
You must type the paragraphs in the correct order
You select from multiple possible orders
You verbally explain the correct order
explanation: In Reorder Paragraphs, text boxes containing paragraphs are shown in a random order, and you must drag and drop them into the correct sequence.

question: What is the response format for Summarize Spoken Text?
explanation: For Summarize Spoken Text, you type a 50-70 word summary in a text box.

question: How does the timer function in the PTE Academic test?
options: A countdown timer for the entire test only
Individual timers for each question but not sections
Individual timers for each section but not questions
Both section timers and individual question timers for timed questions
explanation: The PTE Academic test has both section timers and individual question timers for questions with specific time limits.

question: Can you adjust the volume during the Listening section?
options: Yes, you can adjust it at any time
Yes, but only before the section begins
Only test administrators can adjust volume
explanation: Yes, you can adjust the volume at any time during the Listening section using on-screen controls.

question: What appears on screen during the Speaking section's Describe Image task?
options: An image with preparation and recording timers
explanation: During Describe Image, you see an image along with preparation and recording timers.

question: How is the Fill in the Blanks (Reading) task presented?
options: A passage with blanks where you type words
A passage with blanks where you select from dropdown menus
A passage with highlighted words you must replace
explanation: Fill in the Blanks (Reading) presents a passage with blanks where you select appropriate words from dropdown menus.

question: How many Describe Image tasks are typically in the Speaking section?
explanation: There are typically 6-7 Describe Image tasks in the Speaking section.

question: What is the format of the Answer Short Question task?
options: You read a question and type a short answer
You hear a question and speak a short answer
You select from multiple choice options
You complete a sentence with a missing word
explanation: In Answer Short Question, you hear a question and speak a short answer (usually one word or a few words) into the microphone.

question: What kind of feedback is provided during the test?
options: Immediate feedback on whether answers are correct
Progress indicator showing which section you're in
Estimated final score based on performance so far
Suggestions for improvement on each question
explanation: The test provides a progress indicator showing which section you're in, but no feedback on answer correctness during the test.

question: What options are available for candidates with disabilities?
options: Various accommodations including extended time, breaks, or modified materials
explanation: Various accommodations are available for candidates with disabilities, including extended time, additional breaks, or modified test materials. These must be requested in advance.

question: What is the registration process for PTE Academic?
explanation: Registration for PTE Academic is done online through the Pearson website or app.

question: How far in advance can you book a PTE Academic test?
explanation: You can book a PTE Academic test up to 6 months in advance, depending on test center availability.

question: What happens if you arrive late to your PTE Academic test?
options: You can take the test with reduced time
You will be allowed to reschedule for free
You may be denied entry and forfeit your test fee
The test center will extend hours to accommodate you
explanation: If you arrive late, you may be denied entry to the test and forfeit your test fee. It's recommended to arrive 30 minutes early.

question: How is the Reading & Writing: Fill in the Blanks task different from Reading: Fill in the Blanks?
options: One has more blanks than the other
In one you select from options, in the other you type the answers
One is timed, the other is untimed
explanation: In Reading: Fill in the Blanks, you select from dropdown options; in Reading & Writing: Fill in the Blanks, you type the answers yourself.

question: What is tested in the Summarize Written Text task?
options: Both reading comprehension and writing skills
explanation: Summarize Written Text tests both reading comprehension and writing skills, as you must understand a text and write a concise summary.

question: What's the typical format of the Select Missing Word task?
options: You read a passage with a missing word and select it
You hear an incomplete recording and select the final missing word/phrase
You need to speak the missing word
You type what you think the missing word is
explanation: In Select Missing Word, you hear an incomplete audio recording and must select the option that best completes it.

question: How does the Fill in the Blanks (Listening) task work?
options: You listen and select words from options
You listen and type the exact words you hear in blanks
You predict what words might be in the blanks before listening
explanation: In Fill in the Blanks (Listening), you listen to an audio recording and type the exact words you hear in the blanks provided in the transcript.

question: What's unique about the Answer Short Question task?
options: It's the only task that tests both listening and speaking
It's the only task with yes/no answers
It's the only task with video content
It's the only task with a choice of questions
explanation: Answer Short Question is unique because it tests both listening comprehension (understanding the question) and speaking (providing the answer).

question: What types of images might appear in Describe Image tasks?
options: Various types including graphs, charts, maps, diagrams, and photographs
explanation: Describe Image may include various types of images, including graphs, charts, maps, diagrams, and photographs.

question: How many Write From Dictation tasks typically appear in the test?
explanation: There are typically 5-6 Write From Dictation tasks in the test.

question: What is the format of the test report?
options: Digital score report with overall and communicative skills scores
explanation: The test report is a digital score report showing overall score, communicative skills scores (listening, reading, speaking, writing), and enabling skills scores.

question: Can you request a rescore of your PTE Academic test?
options: No, automated scoring cannot be reviewed
Yes, but only for the speaking section
Yes, but only for writing tasks
explanation: You can request a rescore, but this is only recommended for writing tasks as speaking is scored by automated technology unlikely to change scores.

question: What is the cancellation policy for PTE Academic?
options: Full refund if cancelled at least 24 hours before
Full refund if cancelled at least 7 days before
Partial refund if cancelled at least 14 days before
explanation: You can receive a partial refund if you cancel at least 14 days before your test date.

question: How many times can you replay audio in Listening tasks?
options: Twice for multiple-choice questions, once for others
Never - most audio plays only once
explanation: For most Listening tasks, the audio plays only once without option to replay.

question: How are Summarize Spoken Text responses scored?
options: Only grammar and vocabulary are scored
Content, form, grammar, vocabulary, and spelling are all scored
It's scored based on word count only
explanation: Summarize Spoken Text responses are scored on content, form, grammar, vocabulary, and spelling.

question: Can you bring your own erasable noteboard to the test?
options: Yes, but it must be approved first
No, you must use the one provided by the test center
explanation: No, you must use the erasable noteboard provided by the test center.
